Calculate Triage Effectiveness

Source: R/calc_te.R
calc_te.Rd

Calculates triage effectiveness metrics including Observed Triage Effectiveness (OTE), Theoretical Triage Effectiveness (TTE), and their bootstrap confidence intervals if requested. Note the separate help section on convergence documentation.

calc_te(
  df,
  subgroup = NULL,
  var1 = NULL,
  var2 = NULL,
  bootstrap = FALSE,
  bootstrap_params = list(sample_percentage = 1, n_iterations = 2000, distribution_span =
    0.95),
  n_workers = parallel::detectCores() - 1,
  overall_only = FALSE,
  check_convergence = TRUE,
  min_loset_warning = 5,
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

df

Data frame containing patient data (must be initialized through init())

subgroup

Optional list for subgroup analysis

var1

Optional string for first comparison variable

var2

Optional string for second comparison variable

bootstrap

Logical. Whether to perform bootstrap calculations

bootstrap_params

List of bootstrap parameters:

  • sample_percentage (default: 1)

  • n_iterations (default: 2000)

  • distribution_span (default: 0.95)

n_workers

Number of workers for parallel processing (default: detectCores() - 1)

overall_only

Logical. If TRUE, only overall metrics are returned (default: FALSE)

check_convergence

Logical. If true will return a list with convergence plots (default: TRUE)

min_loset_warning

Numerical, when should the function warn for low loset prevalence? (default: TRUE)

seed

Seed for reprorucible bootstrapping (default: null - no seed)

Value

A list containing:

  • results: Tibble with TE metrics

  • metadata: List with calculation parameters

  • bootstrap_distributions: If applicable, full bootstrap distributions

  • convergence: convergence plots to check that bootstrap reached convergence

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic calculation
te_results <- calc_te(patient_data)

# With bootstrap
te_results <- calc_te(patient_data,
                     bootstrap = TRUE)

# With subgroup analysis
te_results <- calc_te(patient_data,
                     subgroup = list(age_group = "elderly"))
} # }
